title: The Only Self-Tanners You Need to Fake a Beach Club Glow
description: From oils to lotions to tanning pads, we found the crème de la crème of at-home tanning products.
excerpt: All from the comfort of your home.

And since no Charlotte Tilbury product would be complete without a bit of light-reflecting magic, rest assured that this is infused with pixie dust, too—or, more accurately, with light-reflecting pigments that give the sun a beachy gleam. Key ingredients: Hyaluronic acid, DHA, light-reflecting pigments Size: 1 oz Target area: Face Nordstrom rating: 4.5/5 stars A Nordstrom reviewer says: “Beautiful Skin Island Glow Easy Tanning Drops give a natural, sun-kissed glow without streaks. Easy to mix with moisturizer, they leave skin radiant and smooth. No harsh smell, just a flawless tan that builds gradually. A must-have for glowing skin!”Meet the ExpertsIsabel Alysa, celebrity tan artist and founder of Dolce Glow. Melanie Brownlow is the founder of global self-tan brand St. Moriz. Amanda Gabbard is a celebrity makeup artist, beauty educator, and esthetician based in New York City. Jessica Glaser is a registered nurse and the founder of On the Glow Studio.Julie Koritko is a licensed esthetician and the founder of GlowPro Tans. Audrey Spina is the owner of Sweetheart Tan in Irvine, California.Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowHow does self-tanner work?So, what kind of sorcery is actually behind the self-tanning process? Here’s how Brownlow explains it: “The active ingredient which creates the appearance of tanned skin is Dihydroxyacetone, commonly known as DHA.” DHA is naturally derived from plant sources, including sugar beets and sugarcane. “The deepened skin tone that results from self-tanners is the result of the DHA and amino acids in the skin’s surface reacting to one another, leading to a temporary pigment change,” Brownlow explains. “The process usually takes a few hours to develop, depending on the product, and usually lasts several days before fading as the skin naturally exfoliates.”Who is self-tanner best for? According to Brownlow, “Self-tanner is a great option for anyone who is looking to achieve a sun-less sun-kissed complexion. In 2025, there are so many brilliant self-tan and bronzing products on the market that there really is something for all skin types and tones.” She adds that gradual tanning lotions tend to be a great option for those seeking a more natural-looking glow, while classic mousse formulas are ideal for those looking to considerably deepen their skin color.“For those who already have a darker complexion, self-tan is often still used as a way to add further radiance to the skin, leaving a glowy finish,” she says.
html:
Best for an Overnight Glow

St. Moriz Face Glow Mist

Pros

  • Won’t stain clothing or sheets, streak-free

Cons

  • Some users report that the product feels a bit wet and sticky at first

Is your wide-brimmed sun hat working a little too well? Enter this easy-to-use mist. “This was developed to create a fuss-free way to get a glowing complexion on your face to match your body tan,” explains Melanie Brownlow, founder of global self-tan brand St. Moriz. The streak-free formulation contains vitamin E and aloe vera to hydrate and soothe skin while protecting it from environmental pollution. “As with all St. Moriz products, this face mist is also cruelty-free,” Brownlow notes.

Key ingredients: Aloe vera, vitamin E

Type: Mist

Size: 5.07 oz

Target area: Face

Amazon rating: 4.2/5 stars

Our expert says: “This mist is incredibly easy to use. Simply spritz it evenly across your face daily to build your desired glow. With no guide color, this is a great product for an evening application—you can sleep well knowing your sheets won’t be stained.”—Melanie Brownlow

Best for Deep Skin Tones

Dolce Glow by Isabel Alysa Gimme More Contour Self-Tanning Sculptor

Pros

  • Twist-to-unlock packaging makes it virtually leak-proof

Cons

  • Some users wish it were more buildable and easier to blend

This is Miley Cyrus’s go-to self-tanner brand, and she loves it so much that she invested in it. Dolce Glow recently launched an essential tool for those with deeper skin tones who want to get snatched this summer and beyond. A sister to the brand’s original Contour Self-Tanning Glow + Sculpt, which is best suited for fair to medium skin tones, this drop is ideal for those who prefer their contouring to be extra pronounced. And whichever hue you choose, your skin is in good hands: The formulas both have hyaluronic acid and a fruit extract complex to nourish and hydrate.

Key ingredients: Hyaluronic acid, DHA, watermelon, apple, and lentil extracts

Type: Stick

Size: 0.5 oz

Target area: Face

Ulta rating: 4.1/5 stars

Our expert says: “I love to apply this contour at night on my face and let it develop so I wake up with an effortless definition on my face. Then, I like to double up by using it as a bronzer with my makeup the next day. It’s the perfect summer no-makeup-makeup look."—Isabel Alysa, celebrity tan artist and founder of Dolce Glow

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best for Travel

Dr. Dennis Gross Skincare 8-Pack Alpha Beta® Glow Pad™ Self-Tanner For Body

Cons

  • May make olive skin tones appear slightly orange

Dr. Dennis Gross’s Alpha Beta Universal Daily Peel Pads are a beauty editor’s secret for dialing up radiance on the daily. This self-tanning spin on the classic exfoliator presents a mess-free, travel-friendly way to get an even tint on the body. Simply take the pad out of its handy packet, whisk it over the body in circular motions, and expect a tan to develop within the hour. No leaking, no muss, no fuss. Did we mention it’s rinse-free?

Key ingredients: AHAs, BHAs, phospholipids, vitamin E, encapsulated DHA

Type: Pads

Size: Each box comes with eight 0.5-oz towelettes

Target area: Body

Nordstrom rating: 4.1/5 stars

Our expert says: “Though this is primarily intended for the body, you can use it on the face too. Pro tip: Use the self-tanning wipes after the Universal Daily Peel Pad, and you’ve got yourself a next-level, beachy glow.”—Jenny Berg, ELLE contributor

Best Drugstore

Jergens Natural Glow Self Tanner Body Lotion

Pros

  • Packed with antioxidants

Cons

  • The color takes longer to develop, so this is not ideal for a quick color fix

Available in fair to medium and medium to deep, this drugstore gem is ideal for helping the self-tanning rookie ease into the world of sunless color. It delivers a natural-looking glow gradually, with the color developing over the course of a week. It’s also packed with antioxidants that help protect the skin from free-radical damage.

Key ingredients: Coconut oil, vitamin E, jojoba-seed oil, avocado oil

Type: Lotion

Size: 7.5 oz

Target area: Body

Amazon rating: 4.5/5 stars

Our expert says: “This is an affordable, foolproof formula for gradual tanning. I suggest this product for beginners.”—Amanda Gabbard, celebrity makeup artist and esthetician

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best for Sensitive Skin

Miami Gorgeous La Playa Glow Self Tanning Mousse

Pros

  • Skin-loving ingredients

Cons

  • Can be tough to wash off the hands, so it’s best to use a mitt when applying

Suited for sensitive skin, Miami Gorgeous’s easy-to-apply mousse is packed with nourishing ingredients. It has argan and coconut oils to moisturize, vitamins A, C, and D for antioxidant protection, and elderflower extract to soothe irritation while boosting skin’s radiance and elasticity. What’s more, its organic DHA (AKA, the ingredient that interacts with amino acids in the skin to deepen its color) has a seal of approval from Ecocert. The French certification body rigorously tests products for harmful ingredients and environmental responsibility.

Key ingredients: Argan oil, coconut oil, vitamins A, C, and D

Type: Mousse

Size: 4.2 oz

Target area: Body

Amazon rating: 4.3/5 stars

Our expert says: “Fast-drying and made with natural ingredients, this is great for getting a beach-day look. My hack: Use a mitt to apply it—otherwise, it can absorb quickly in between your fingers.” —Amanda Gabbard

Best Tanning Drops

Isle of Paradise Self Tanning Firming Body Drops

Pros

  • Creates a customizable tan

Cons

  • Must be mixed in with other products to work

Made with caffeine to give the skin a tighter, firmer look, Isle of Paradise’s tanning drops moisturize the skin with baobab and soothe inflammation with a dash of oat extract. The product works when dropped into a moisturizer or oil. Simply mix in six to twelve drops, depending on how deep you like your color, and voila, you’ve created your own self-tanner. The drops come in three shades—Fair, Medium, and Dark—and there’s also a version for the face.

Key ingredients: Caffeine, baobab, oat extract

Type: Drops Size: 2.5 oz

Target area: Body

Amazon rating: 4/5 stars

Our expert says: The Isle of Paradise drops in Dark are great, but you’d need to be pretty fair to get good color payoff on the Medium ones. The best part about tanning drops is that they play nicely with your skin care routine.”—Julie Koritko, licensed esthetician and founder of GlowPro Tans

Best for a No-Makeup Makeup Look

Drunk Elephant Liquid Bronzer

Cons

  • Can feel a bit greasy on the skin

Craving a quick complexion warmup? Drunk Elephant’s Sunshine Drops are like drops of sunshine for the skin, offering a wash of bronze that mimics a post-vacation glow. Made with cocoa extracts for antioxidant protection, peptides to smooth out fine lines and wrinkles, and chronoyclin to minimize signs of aging, the drops are simple to use. Just add one or more of them to your moisturizer of choice and smooth the mixture onto any area needing a pop of color.

Key ingredients: Cocoa extracts, peptides, chronocyclin

Type: Drops

Size: 1 oz

Target area: Face and body

Sephora rating: 4/5 stars

Our expert says: “I love mixing this in with body lotion or body oil. I also use a few drops in foundation for extra glow.” —Amanda Gabbard

Best for Olive Skin Tones

Mine Violet Self Tanning Foam

Cons

  • Not ideal for fair skin tones

Those with olive skin tones should add this Minetan formula to their summer stash. Designed with violet pigments to counteract any orange or yellow tones, the foam is a tanning pro’s pick for their olive-complected clients. Got a different skin tone? Don’t fret: MineTan has other formulas better suited for all tones. The vegan formula suits all skin types, creates a tan within an hour, and it’s loaded with skin-loving ingredients, including vitamin E and avocado oil.

Key ingredients: DHA, violet pigments, coconut oil, macadamia oil, vitamin E, avocado oil

Type: Foam

Size: 6.7 oz

Target area: Face and body

Amazon rating: 4.2/5 stars

Our expert says: “One of the self-tanners I come back to again and again is MineTan Violet Self Tan Foam, which is one of the most reliable options for avoiding orange tones. It’s especially great for warm or olive undertones and dries quickly, which makes it easy to work with.” —Audrey Spina

Best for Quick Touch-Ups

Loving Tan 2 Hour Express Deluxe Bronzing Mousse

Cons

  • The initial color may appear too dark, but it evens out after a rinse

Available in three shades ranging from medium to ultra-dark, Loving Tan’s mousse makes it a cinch to achieve a quick, even tan as the clock ticks down to a big event. With a tinted color guide to ward off any streaks, the product dries in 60 seconds; the tan will develop within a couple of hours. As a fragrant perk, the formula smells of fresh roses.

Key ingredients: Witch hazel water, black walnut shell extract, aloe vera leaf juice

Type: Mousse

Size: 6.7 oz

Target area: Body

Nordstrom rating: 4.8/5 stars

Our expert says: “This is a favorite of mine for its rich, natural-looking color and fast development time. It’s ideal for clients prepping last-minute for an event.” —Audrey Spina

Best for Sensitive Skin

Tanologist Express Medium Self Tan Water

Cons

  • Some users notice a slight chemical smell

This dermatologist-tested tanning water tends to the skin with a trio of pink grapefruit, goji berry, and juniper to soften, hydrate, and brighten. The formula is clear, so there’s no danger of stains or transfer onto clothing and sheets, and it comes in four shades ranging from Light to Extra Dark. Safe for sensitive skin, the tanning water is also non-comedogenic and easy to apply: Spritz it onto the body or face, and rub it in with a mitt, and you’re good to glow.

Key ingredients: Pink grapefruit, gogi berry, juniper

Type: Water

Size: 6.76 oz

Target area: Body and face

Amazon rating: 4.4/5 stars

Our expert says: “For beginners or anyone with sensitive skin, I often recommend Tanologist Express Self Tan Water. It’s clear, so there’s no color transfer, and the lightweight mist makes it easy to apply and build gradually.” —Audrey Spina

Best for Mature Skin

St. tropez St. Tropez Luxe Whipped Crème Mousse

Cons

  • Some users report that it tends to transfer onto clothing and sheets if not properly set

Dermatologist-tested and cruelty-free, this celebrity favorite is infused with ingredients that pamper the skin. With hyaluronic acid, niacinamide, echinacea, and Vitamin E, it soothes redness and irritation while hydrating the skin and evening out its. The tinted, lotion-to-mousse formula makes for easy, streak-free application, and the tan develops instantly while the formula dries in seconds, leaving a satiny finish behind.

Key ingredients: Hyaluronic acid, niacinamide, echinacea, vitamin E

Type: Lotion-to-mousse

Size: 6.8 oz

Target area: Body and face

Nordstrom rating: 4.8/5 stars

Our expert says: “I love St. Tropez Luxe Whipped Crème Mousse, especially for dry or mature skin. It’s hydrating, includes ingredients like niacinamide and hyaluronic acid, and gives a smooth, even finish that looks and feels like skin care.” —Audrey Spina

Best for Legs

TAN-LUXE The Gradual - Illuminating Gradual Tan Lotion

Cons

  • Some users report inconsistent tan-development times, ranging from two to 12 hours

Enriched with raspberry seed oil to moisturize, aloe vera to soothe, and cellutone complex to firm the skin, Tan-Luxe’s gradual tan lotion creates gleaming, glowing skin all over the body. (Based on customer reviews, it’s particularly popular for adding a pop of color to the legs.) The buildable formula typically delivers color in four to six hours, and an infusion of light-reflective micro particles gives it a shimmery finish.

Key ingredients: Raspberry seed oil, aloe vera, cellutone complex

How does self-tanner work?

So, what kind of sorcery is actually behind the self-tanning process? Here’s how Brownlow explains it: “The active ingredient which creates the appearance of tanned skin is Dihydroxyacetone, commonly known as DHA.” DHA is naturally derived from plant sources, including sugar beets and sugarcane. “The deepened skin tone that results from self-tanners is the result of the DHA and amino acids in the skin’s surface reacting to one another, leading to a temporary pigment change,” Brownlow explains. “The process usually takes a few hours to develop, depending on the product, and usually lasts several days before fading as the skin naturally exfoliates.”

Who is self-tanner best for?

According to Brownlow, “Self-tanner is a great option for anyone who is looking to achieve a sun-less sun-kissed complexion. In 2025, there are so many brilliant self-tan and bronzing products on the market that there really is something for all skin types and tones.” She adds that gradual tanning lotions tend to be a great option for those seeking a more natural-looking glow, while classic mousse formulas are ideal for those looking to considerably deepen their skin color.“For those who already have a darker complexion, self-tan is often still used as a way to add further radiance to the skin, leaving a glowy finish,” she says.
